newsitem.title: ESTONIA: HANDELSBANKEN AIMS AT BALTIC BANKING.
newsitem.headline: HANDELSBANKEN AIMS AT BALTIC BANKING.

text.p: Svenka Handelsbanken said on Tuesday that it aims to have full banking operations in at least one of the Baltic states within two to three years.
The bank last month bought Estonian brokerage Aktoris.
Handelsbanken vice president and Baltic area manager Bo Kragh said the aim was to start banking in the Baltic states.
"The long term aim...is for two to three years," Kragh told Reuters in an interview.
"It may not happen in all three republics at the same time but it should happen in at least one," he added.
With its move to Estonia, Handelsbanken was the first foreign bank to launch a brokerage operation in the Baltics.
But Kragh said Handelsbanken has been considering expansion to the three countries for several years.
"As early as 1992 in our in-house policy there was...one paragraph saying that the Baltic countries should also be considered as part of the home market," he said.
But Kragh said it was not yet decided how Hansdelsbanken will carry out the Baltic expansion and where it will first launch new services.

Handelsbanken's first step in the Baltics was taken with the opening of a representative office in Estonia in 1995 and the second move was the bank's becoming a member of the Tallinn stock exchange on March 24 with its purchase of Aktoris.
"We anticipate further steps, in exactly what form remains to be seen," Kragh said.
